Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is thickly encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394256) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394256)
